channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Acorns, 25th September
item.description:
Resident called report they are lots of acorns all over the surrounding footpaths near Mason close . She would also like know if any footway repairs are take place in Mason close. Please can we call her back to advise.

item.description:

item.title: Fly Tipped Building Waste in Park / woods, 25th September
item.description:
Some fool has fly tipped a load of domestic building waste bricks and paint cans on the edge of the park land on the hill on Thorntree Road. It's about two thirds of the way up. Please would you remove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thorntree Road, Charlton Riverside, London

item.title: Large quantity of rubbish dumped by the Virgin Media Green Cabinet, Halt Robin Road Belvedere DA17, 25th September
item.description:
A large quantity of rubbish has been dumped by the Virgin Media Green Cabinet on the pavement of Halt Robin Road, Belvedere DA17, almost at the junction with Picardy Road Belvedere DA17. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the rubbish as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bunkers Hill, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation, 25th September
item.description:
This has been a problem for many years, but seems to be covering a greater area of the pathway this year. The vegetation is a mixture of stinging nettles and brambles. My husband is registered blind and currently without a working guide dog and has received a number of injuries along this stretch of pavement while walking his now retired dog. Hopefully you can see from the photos that there is limited space for a parent with a child in a buggy would also struggle to use this part of the pavement safely, especially if they had additional children walking alongside. I don't know who owns the land where these plants are growing, but would appreciate a swift resolution.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ellenborough Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please write email saying can the management of y Bromley Counci please look into this as right along king hall road Litter and leaves on road has been left by the person who the cut grass the other day and it very untidy the way its been left and needs looking soon as possible, 25th September
item.description:
Bromley Council Management, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to bring to your attention the current condition along King Hall Road, where litter and leaves have been left scattered following recent grass cutting. It appears that the individual responsible for the cutting did not clear the debris afterwards, leaving the area looking very untidy. I kindly ask that the management team look into this matter as soon as possible, as the road requires cleaning to restore its proper appearance and maintain public standards. Thank you for your attention to this issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cottingham Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refuse collectors leaving bin bags in open, 25th September
item.description:
There was waste picked on top of our recycling bins this morning. To empty the bins, the collection team have left all the waste on the floor and in the open, adjacent to a very spacious and empty bin shed. This is completely unacceptable. Please attend and clear up (bin store at North of Millpond Estate)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bermondsey Wall East, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
